MONL.content: [re: barred access to Arabic, Berber] “the inscription of this limit could not leave traces”: multiply symptoms of a fascination
MONL.linkedContent: [re: barred access to Arabic, Berber] “the inscription of this limit could not leave traces”: multiply symptoms of a fascination

FL.content: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]
FL.linkedContent: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]

A.content: aporia, experience of what’s fascinating in the nonpassage: “not knowing where to go,” paralyzed by separation
A.linkedContent: aporia, experience of what’s fascinating in the nonpassage: “not knowing where to go,” paralyzed by separation

EM.content: question of humanism contemporary w/ spellbinding (fascinante) extension of “human sciences” w/in philosophical field
EM.linkedContent: question of humanism contemporary w/ spellbinding (fascinante) extension of “human sciences” w/in philosophical field

PP.content: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm
PP.linkedContent: written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm

PP.content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

P(I).content: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable
P(I).linkedContent: la force de hantise [that drives Derrida to Blanchot or Blanchot to Blanchot], injunction of a truth w/out truth, toujours au-delà de la fascination dont on parle à leur sujet > fascination de la loi, ce qui semble inimaginable, ou inconcevable, sinon impensable

PAS.content: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination
PAS.linkedContent: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination

PAS.content: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project
PAS.linkedContent: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project

PAS.content: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves, and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves, and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens

PAS.content: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come
PAS.linkedContent: wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come

PAS.content: always the other’s fascination, no opposition to fascination, only differences of force
PAS.linkedContent: always the other’s fascination, no opposition to fascination, only differences of force

PAS.content: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach
PAS.linkedContent: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach

PAS.content: acc. Derrida, all [?] Blanchot’s books concern fascinating ellipsis (l’ellipse fascinante) of what leaves the sea
PAS.linkedContent: acc. Derrida, all [?] Blanchot’s books concern fascinating ellipsis (l’ellipse fascinante) of what leaves the sea

PPHS.content: [method, compare to Nietzschean interpretation] Derrida will look 1) at the ruptures, breaks, discontinuities of long but finite historical continuum/sequence of metaphysics re: sign as referral to presence 2) and at the sequence itself, ample chains of predicates that aren’t interrupted by fascinating rupturing events
PPHS.linkedContent: [method, compare to Nietzschean interpretation] Derrida will look 1) at the ruptures, breaks, discontinuities of long but finite historical continuum/sequence of metaphysics re: sign as referral to presence 2) and at the sequence itself, ample chains of predicates that aren’t interrupted by fascinating rupturing events

SH.content: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis & caesura of discretion [Blanchot] inhabit the shibboleth (Joyce), it fascinates, seduces

SH.content: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)
SH.linkedContent: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)

F.content: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues
F.linkedContent: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues

F.content: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)
F.linkedContent: paelontologist médusé devant l’arête d’un mot-chose, like a tomb burning in the grass, double-edged stare of a 2-faced Medusa (le double tranchant d’un biface)

P.content: Kant’s beauty [wild tulip] requires absolute interruption: straining toward end w/out goal, not pure if cut can be bandaged (pansable), no pure cut (if it could be prolonged, completed, supplemented), no beauty > everything in it straining toward the bout (end, blow)
P.linkedContent: Kant’s beauty [wild tulip] requires absolute interruption: straining toward end w/out goal, not pure if cut can be bandaged (pansable), no pure cut (if it could be prolonged, completed, supplemented), no beauty > everything in it straining toward the bout (end, blow)

P.content: this fascination w/out desire, in view of an end never in view, a but en blanc [“point blank”] > interrupted finality must show itself as finality & interrupture, as edging
P.linkedContent: this fascination w/out desire, in view of an end never in view, a but en blanc [“point blank”] > interrupted finality must show itself as finality & interrupture, as edging

P.content: it is the sans that counts for beauty, la bordure [edging] en sans de la coupure pure
P.linkedContent: it is the sans that counts for beauty, la bordure [edging] en sans de la coupure pure

FS.content: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]
FS.linkedContent: form fascinates when one no longer has force to understand force w/in itself [decadence?]

DPi.content: [via Genet, great witness/man of theater of our time] equal fascination w/ weapon of crime & weapon of capital punishment (another kind of crime) > fascination w/ spectacle, one condemned to death becomes parody, comedy, imitation of Christ
DPi.linkedContent: [via Genet, great witness/man of theater of our time] equal fascination w/ weapon of crime & weapon of capital punishment (another kind of crime) > fascination w/ spectacle, one condemned to death becomes parody, comedy, imitation of Christ

DPi.content: theater of cruelty, scopic drive, fascinatio, enchantment that chains spectator to spectacle (fascio, to tense, tie, attach, fasciola is a bandage wrapping [bandelette]) > what links voyeur-spectator to fascinum, charm, enchantment, virile sex
DPi.linkedContent: theater of cruelty, scopic drive, fascinatio, enchantment that chains spectator to spectacle (fascio, to tense, tie, attach, fasciola is a bandage wrapping [bandelette]) > what links voyeur-spectator to fascinum, charm, enchantment, virile sex

DPi.content: to executioner: “so, you got a hard-on! (tu bandes!)” (link to erection at moment of decapitation)
DPi.linkedContent: to executioner: “so, you got a hard-on! (tu bandes!)” (link to erection at moment of decapitation)

DPi.content: all fascination: virtual involvement w/ perversity/perversion
DPi.linkedContent: all fascination: virtual involvement w/ perversity/perversion

DPi.content: logic of fascination best argument against punishment as exemplarity: bad example risks becoming fascinating martyr, hero, the good example [Genet] (perversion of the imitation of Christ)
DPi.linkedContent: logic of fascination best argument against punishment as exemplarity: bad example risks becoming fascinating martyr, hero, the good example [Genet] (perversion of the imitation of Christ)

DPi.content: DP seduces, vanity beyond death, those fascinated by it can take maximum pleasure from (jouir de) it
DPi.linkedContent: DP seduces, vanity beyond death, those fascinated by it can take maximum pleasure from (jouir de) it

DPi.content: DP masters future through machines, or purports to, deprives me of my own finitude, exonerates me of my experience of finitude > thus the seductive fascination it exerts on side of condemning power and side of condemned > fascinated by power of calculation, end of finitude, end of of anxiety, protects against irruption of other > all this decidability remains phantasms > origin of phantasms in general—and perhaps of religion
DPi.linkedContent: DP masters future through machines, or purports to, deprives me of my own finitude, exonerates me of my experience of finitude > thus the seductive fascination it exerts on side of condemning power and side of condemned > fascinated by power of calculation, end of finitude, end of of anxiety, protects against irruption of other > all this decidability remains phantasms > origin of phantasms in general—and perhaps of religion

TB.content: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly

TB.content: untouchable: fascinates, orients work of translator

PIO.content: mirror as predicament, necessary or fateful situation > caught in mirror’s fatal & fascinating trap
PIO.linkedContent: mirror as predicament, necessary or fateful situation > caught in mirror’s fatal & fascinating trap

WAP.content: teaching body fascinates when it’s more than a center: its excentricity permits synoptic surveillance covering field of (indistinguishable) body taught & permits withdrawal, reserve, of body that does not surrender, offering itself from only one side [visor effect?]
WAP.linkedContent: teaching body fascinates when it’s more than a center: its excentricity permits synoptic surveillance covering field of (indistinguishable) body taught & permits withdrawal, reserve, of body that does not surrender, offering itself from only one side [visor effect?]

WAP.content: my body > cadaverization of my body, capturing by erasure, fascinating neutralization > my body only fascinates while playing dead, when erected in rigidity of cadaver (delegation of life)
WAP.linkedContent: my body > cadaverization of my body, capturing by erasure, fascinating neutralization > my body only fascinates while playing dead, when erected in rigidity of cadaver (delegation of life)

D.content: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves
D.linkedContent: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves

D.content: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance
D.linkedContent: moment of present meaning: their “content” only surface effect into which you tombez sans cesse, fascinés by appearance

EL.content: Scholem’s equivocal use of word apocalypse, fascination w/ abyss : indecision that he can’t, doesn’t want, to master > apocalypse should be guarded (saved), and we should guard against it
EL.linkedContent: Scholem’s equivocal use of word apocalypse, fascination w/ abyss : indecision that he can’t, doesn’t want, to master > apocalypse should be guarded (saved), and we should guard against it

PPT.content: le trait il s’y attire et s’y passe, de lui-même: situated, situates, btwn visible edging (la bordure visible) and phantom in center—from which we fascinate
PPT.linkedContent: le trait il s’y attire et s’y passe, de lui-même: situated, situates, btwn visible edging (la bordure visible) and phantom in center—from which we fascinate

C.content: theory of coffins, series w/out model, w/out example (procession in double band fascinates, can’t see there’s no example) > obsequence of this cortege in singular lineage
C.linkedContent: theory of coffins, series w/out model, w/out example (procession in double band fascinates, can’t see there’s no example) > obsequence of this cortege in singular lineage

C.content: “don’t deliver them from fascination just when they’re falling into the abyss of the infinite—yet nil—distance, the outsize (démesuré) space”
C.linkedContent: “don’t deliver them from fascination just when they’re falling into the abyss of the infinite—yet nil—distance, the outsize (démesuré) space”

BSi.content: sovereign/beast outside law > beast: violation of law, also Benjamin’s grand criminal, reveals state doesn’t monopolize violence; sovereign: guarantor of law, heterogenous to law > haunting, uncanny fascination: beast/sovereign face
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign/beast outside law > beast: violation of law, also Benjamin’s grand criminal, reveals state doesn’t monopolize violence; sovereign: guarantor of law, heterogenous to law > haunting, uncanny fascination: beast/sovereign face

BSi.content: sovereign state as Leviathan, as animal-machine, as prosthstatics > beast et (est) sovereign coupled across a copula: affinity through analogy, proportion, reciprocal fascination—or grafting
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign state as Leviathan, as animal-machine, as prosthstatics > beast et (est) sovereign coupled across a copula: affinity through analogy, proportion, reciprocal fascination—or grafting

OG.content: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè
OG.linkedContent: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè

EU.content: double bind that knots around sublime body of “teacher of philosophizing” [i.e. philosophy eludes teaching, philosophizing requires it]: teacher haunts the scene, doesn’t dominate, or dominates like a ghost > one might say he fascinates/seduces if these connotations weren’t too closely tied to imagination/sensibility: for reason should break the charm [of sensibility?]
EU.linkedContent: double bind that knots around sublime body of “teacher of philosophizing” [i.e. philosophy eludes teaching, philosophizing requires it]: teacher haunts the scene, doesn’t dominate, or dominates like a ghost > one might say he fascinates/seduces if these connotations weren’t too closely tied to imagination/sensibility: for reason should break the charm [of sensibility?]
